ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Using science as it relates to real world and policy issues.
I learned to understand the history and development of technologies in new perspectives, how to find credible resources, and how to collaborate with others through online communication.

This class provided a very thorough analysis of how certain technologies work in non-stem language. I feel confident that I can explain how these things work because the science was explained in a very helpful way.
How to discuss public policy of modern technology innovations

I learned about the science behind seemingly magical technology. The transmission of an image over long distances, for instance, occurs due to the fiber optic cables sending signals. I did not know that before the class. I also learned that the most important thing to do in a complex situation is ask the right question.
I also learned how to research on pubmed because my presentation required it.
The course covers modern technologies ranging from electrical cars to computer transistors, and the policy background that informs and affects these technologies.
General physics and energy knowledge

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The instructor was knowledgeable and interesting. The TA was incredibly resourceful and helpful in getting through the coursework.
The strengths are the intriguing guest lectures and the professor's humorous and passionate teaching style. I don't think there's a weakness in the course.

I feel like this course was accessible in the way that the concepts were explained. The only weakness I can comment on is that there could have been a wider range of topics that we could have discussed, but we were a little limited by the duration of the course.
too much lecture, not enough discussion

Strengths: Prober is kind and incredibly knowledgeable and same with his TA. The class covers interesting stuff most of the time. I love how it bounces from topic to topic because the student is bound to find one which they love. Mine, for example, was the nuclear bomb lecture.
Weaknesses: the three hour lectures are tough, but that is what i signed up for.

The course is well constructed: three homework assignments, a midterm examination, and a final presentation. The professor and TA offer helpful comments on all assignments, and are prompt in reply. There are really no weaknesses that come to mind.
Quite long classes and lectures with low levels of student interaction

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to anyone interested in technology and/or the policy and implications surrounding it. This course was very informative and approachable from a non-STEM background
Of course. It was the perfect class for non science majors to have a scientific experience.
Yes because the course was easy to absorb, and it provided deep insights into how technology changed the way we live.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student! This course was very well-organized and Professor Prober is very patient and understanding. This course explains scientific concepts very thoroughly and in language that is accessible to non-stem majors.
Yes, good to know information
Yes if you need to take a summer science credit do this class.

Yes: Professor Prober is both extremely knowledgeable about the material taught and extremely competent at communicating that material so that it is both easily and thoroughly understood. In addition, the course's content is extremely interesting. I could not recommend the class more highly.
Yes, is a good science credit over the summer with a very nice instructor.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
comments: Agree
Agree
Agree

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I will use it when I consider policy related to the environment.

The information in this course will be essential to my research in Science, Technology and Society areas, and many lectures about sustainability at Yale also helped me gain a general understanding of how cogeneration power works.
I will learn the science behind technologies and also tey to ask the right questions.

extras.title: APHY S100E 01/ENAS S100E 01/PHYS S100E 01 - Sc of ModTech and PublicPolicy
